article_title: How secret offshore money helps fuel Miami’s luxury real-estate boom
article_text:
People linked to wrongdoing abroad are buying condos in South Florida

The buyers turned up in a massive leak of secret files from offshore companies

Flood of foreign cash helps crowd locals out of hot housing market

article_metadata.news-keywords: miami, panama papers, real estate, luxury, condos, offshore companies, money laundering, dirty money, florida, drug trafficking, corruption, mossack fonseca, south florida, brazil, sunny isles, brickell, miami beach, crime, housing, home, paulo octavio, helder zebral, joaquim barbosa, brasilia, secret shell game
article_metadata.description: People accused of corruption are setting up offshore companies and funneling cash into Miami condos and mansions, according to a massive leak of secret documents called the “Panama Papers.” That’s raising fears of money laundering in luxury South Florida real estate.
article_metadata.title: How secret offshore money helps fuel Miami’s luxury real-estate boom | Miami Herald
